column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: There is a requirement for all Spark employees and contractors to complete mandatory e-learning modules when they commence working at Spark. These learning modules ensure proficiency in core foundational areas, such as health and safety, legal, privacy, decision-making, reporting and security.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Spark continued to weave Mahi Tahi, Spark's wellbeing programme, into their people's experiences and ways of working throughout FY23 so that wellbeing remained a key focus for Spark's people and leaders. Mahi Tahi works with Spark people to support their work and life goals.

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, Spark Foundation invested over $1.8 million into organizations and projects that accelerate Digital Equity. Around 80% of project funding supports nine multi-year partnerships spanning two to five years.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Recycle A Device (RAD) takes second-hand laptops donated by businesses and households, teaches local students to refurbish them, and then gets them into the hands of those who need them the most. The result is an end-to-end process of device collection, refurbishment, distribution, and disposal that enhances digital equity at every level, providing highly sought-after tools, access, and skills to rangatahi (young people) while also offering the added environmental benefit of diverting e-waste from landfill by giving these laptops a second life.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column9: PACE: Porirua Access Connectivity and Education
column13: Following a community talanoa in 2020 organized by Spark's Vaka Pasifika team, a community initiative, PACE, was formed to address the digital access, connectivity, and education divide in Porirua, Wellington, specifically. PACE will collaborate with established local organizations and government and non-government organizations to accelerate its efforts on the broader community.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Spark encourages people to give back to the community through our Spark Give and Spark Volunteer programmes. Spark provides the Spark Give and Spark Volunteer programmes, matches employee charitable donations (up to a total pool of $250,000 per year), and gives all Spark people one day of leave a year to commit to volunteering.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, Spark donated nearly $1.6 million to Spark Foundation, with $1 million explicitly designated for community projects and the remaining funding operational costs. Combined with Spark Foundation's sale of its art collection, over $1.8 million was invested in community initiatives and projects accelerating digital equity.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Spark payroll giving programme enables our people to donate to schools and charities via their pay. Spark matches donations towards our four key partners through Spark Give dollar-for-dollar (up to a cap of $250,000 per year).

New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: A human rights policy is a formal statement or document that outlines a spark's commitment to upholding and respecting human rights within its sphere of influence. This Policy articulates the organization's stance on fundamental human rights principles and guides its internal and external activities.

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: A human rights screening process is a systematic evaluation or assessment conducted by Spark Limited to identify, prevent, and address potential human rights risks and impacts associated with their operations, products, services, or suppliers. The screening process ensures that an organization conducts activities consistent with human rights principles, avoids causing or contributing to human rights abuses, and takes corrective actions when necessary.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Spark publishes a dedicated annual Modern Slavery Statement. This report provides a detailed summary of our approach to addressing modern slavery and managing broader risk in our supply chain, including actions taken over the past year to strengthen our systems and processes.

column13: Regular internal communication refers to the consistent and ongoing exchange of information, messages, and updates within an organization, primarily directed toward its employees. This communication is vital for keeping employees informed, engaged, and aligned with the marketing activities.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
column13: Engagement with commerce commissions typically refers to interactions, communications, or collaborations between Spark Limited and the relevant commerce commission or regulatory body. Commerce commissions are regulatory authorities that enforce competition, consumer protection, and fair trading practices within a specific jurisdiction.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
column13: Retail Service Quality (RSQ) refers to assessing and measuring the quality of services retailers provide to their customers. It involves evaluating various aspects of the customer experience, from when a customer enters a store or engages with an online platform to completing a purchase and post-purchase support.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column7: In FY23, Spark received 19 substantiated privacy complaints from customers, in which we identified opportunities for minor enhancements to our practices and processes or targeted coaching.
